byline.contributor: Julie Bosman contributed reporting from Chicago.

abstract: New concerns surface in Flint, Mich, after officials say that tests of unfiltered tap water find levels of lead in some samples higher than what filters distributed to residents are designed to remove; as many as 8,000 children under age 6 are believed to have been exposed to lead, possibly suffering irreversible damage to their developing brains and nervous systems.
lead_paragraph: As officials try to track how many children in Flint, Mich., have been exposed to lead, underlying troubles prevalent among low-income families add to concerns.

headline.main: Flint Weighs Scope of Harm to Children Caused by Lead in Water
headline.print_headline: Flint Tallies Tainted Water’s Cost to Its Children

snippet: As officials try to track how many children in Flint, Mich., have been exposed to lead, underlying troubles prevalent among low-income families add to concerns.
